alert.note: Alert for Northern Aitkin; South Aitkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 6:49PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A LINE OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT EASTERN AND CENTRAL AITKIN COUNTY... At 646 PM CDT, an area of heavy snow showers were along a line extending from Jacobson to McGrath, and moving west at 5 mph. Visibilities of 1/4 mile or less, wind gusts up to 40 mph, and rapid snow accumulation on roads are expected with this area of heavy snow showers. Other locations impacted by this area of heavy snow showers include Arthyde, Flowage Lake, Ball Bluff, Sheshebee, Lawler, Dads Corner, Savanna Portage State Park, Balsam, Rice Lake Wildlife Refuge and Kimberly. Conditions will deteriorate rapidly within this line of heavy snowfall. Be prepared for wet and slushy snow quickly accumulating on the roadways. Slow down, allow extra following and stopping distance between you and the vehicle in front of you, and allow extra time to reach your destination.
